intro: Erythrodes bidentifera, commonly known as the two-toothed erythrodes, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are often eaten by various bird species. The plant is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories.
